page.title: 08Medstead Village Green
page.content:
The Green named in the Tithe map of 1845 as "The Down" covers an area of 11.812 acres. Originally owned by the Church Commissioners it was leased at an annual cost of 5/-! (25p). In July 1955 the Parish Council purchased it outright, together with other land for a total of what was then Â£20.
In 1958 a Royal Commission into the state of Common and Village Greens, recommended amongst other things that there should be a register maintained of all such land to preserve it for the future. As a result, the Commons Registration Act of 1965 came into being, whereby all Commons and Village Greens needed to be Registered if they were to be preserved for the future "enjoyment of air, exercise and recreation" by residents. /cont. page 9
